title: Assistant Professor in Clinical Embryology
text:
Click here to view our Employer Video 
Location: UK Other 
Salary: £34,233 to £45,954 per annum, depending on skills and experience. Salary progression beyond this scale is subject to performance with up to 15% clinical supplement depending on qualifications and experience. 
Applications are invited for the above post based within the Division of Child Health Obstetrics and Gynaecology at the Queen’s Medical Centre, Nottingham. The purpose of this role is to support the teaching and research activities of the Division. Specifically, the post holder would be expected to play a major role in the provision of both teaching in clinical embryology and administration of the taught Masters Course in Assisted Conception (M.Med.Sci in Assisted Reproduction Technology (ART)) that is in its 20 th year. The post holder will also be expected to generate an active research programme, secure external funding and to supervise postgraduate research students. In this regard, although there are no direct clinical duties associated with this post, the successful applicant will be encouraged to remain current in terms of their clinical skills, particularly in relation to research projects in this area. Finally, the post holder will be expected to accept significant administrative responsibility in the management of the course within the Division and other duties as required. 
The post would therefore be suitable for an experienced clinical embryologist with an academic background that wishes to develop a stronger academic profile. Candidates must have a PhD, a Certificate/Diploma in clinical embryology (or equivalent) from a recognised source and significant experience in clinical embryology. 
Informal enquiries may be addressed to Prof. Bruce Campbell, tel: 0115 8230688 or email bruce.campbell@nottingham.ac.uk . Please note that applications sent directly to this email address will not be accepted. Share this job
